parsed.internal_thinking: Analyzing the board for the best starting position. Alice took Node 20 (11-6-8: Wood, Brick, Sheep) and Bob took Node 12 (3-6-5: Wood, Brick, Sheep). The highest yield area left is the Wheat/Ore cluster at the bottom. Node 43 has a massive 13-pip yield (Wheat 9, Wheat 6, Wheat 9). Node 42 is also strong with 12 pips (Wheat 9, Ore 5, Wheat 9). Since I am Charlie and it's a 3-player game, I will place my first and second settlements back-to-back (snake draft: Alice, Bob, Charlie, Charlie, Bob, Alice). This allows me to secure both Node 43 and Node 41 (Ore 5, Wheat 9, Brick 10) for a total of 24 pips. This 'Wheat/Ore' strategy is incredibly potent, especially since I'll control the best Ore spot (5) and the best Wheat spots (9, 6). I'll start by placing my first settlement on Node 43. parsed.note_to_self: Planning to take Node 43 now and Node 41 immediately after for my second settlement. This will give me a dominant position in Wheat and Ore, with a decent Brick source. I'll need to trade for Wood and Sheep early on, or aim for the 3:1 port at Node 50 which is only one road away from Node 41.
parsed.say_outloud: hey everyone! good luck. those are some solid spots you guys picked out. i think i'll try my luck down here by the wheat fields and see if i can get a good harvest going.
